duck: corneal endothelium - The corneal endothelium is a single layer of cells on the inner surface of the cornea.
Endocardium - The endocardium is the innermost layer of tissue that lines the chambers of the heart.
Apelin - Apelin is a peptide that in humans is encoded by the APLN gene.
Endothelial activation - Endothelial activation is a proinflammatory and procoagulant state of the endothelial cells lining the lumen of blood vessels.
endothelium definition: an epithelium of mesodermal origin composed of a single layer of thin flattened cells that lines internal body cavities and the lumens of vessels.
Epithelium - Epithelium is one of the four basic types of animal tissue, along with connective tissue, muscle tissue and nervous tissue.
Caveolae - In biology, caveolae, which are a special type of lipid raft, are small invaginations of the plasma membrane in many vertebrate cell types, especially in endothelial cells and adipocytes.

The endothelium is the thin layer of cells that lines the interior surface of blood vessels and lymphatic vessels, forming an interface between circulating blood or lymph in the lumen and the rest of the vessel wall.

milestones: Scientists grow beating rat heart in lab

Endothelial cell.jpg | Caption = Diagram showing the location of endothelial
cells | Image2 = Microvessel.jpg | Caption2 = Endothelial cells, which form
the tunica intima, encircle an erythrocyte (E). | Precursor = | System = |
Artery = | Vein = | Nerve = | Lymph = | MeshName = | MeshNumber = | Code = |
}} The 'endothelium' is the thin layer of cells that lines the interior
surface of blood vessels and lymphatic vessels,<ref></ref> forming an
interface between circulating blood or lymph in the lumen and the rest of the
vessel wall. The cells that form the endothelium are called 'endothelial
cells'. Endothelial cells in direct contact with blood are called vascular
endothelial cells, whereas those in direct contact with lymph are known as
lymphatic endothelial cells.

Vascular endothelial cells line the entire circulatory system, from the heart to
the smallest capillaries. These cells have very distinct and unique functions
that are paramount to vascular biology. These functions include fluid
filtration, such as in the glomeruli of the kidney, blood vessel tone,
hemostasis, neutrophil recruitment, and hormone trafficking. Endothelium of the
interior surfaces of the heart chambers are called endocardium.
wiki.title: Endothelium
